content:
That's great to hear! If you're within the one-month timeframe, you should be able to return the packing materials and get your refund. Just make sure to check the exact return policy and any specific requirements the moving company may have, such as:

* The condition of the packing materials: Are they in good condition, or are they damaged in any way?
* The type of materials: Are you returning all the original materials, or are some missing or damaged?
* The return process: Do you need to schedule a pickup, or can you drop off the materials at a specific location?
* Any necessary documentation: Do you need to provide a receipt or proof of purchase to facilitate the refund?

Double-check the moving company's website, contract, or contact their customer service to confirm their return policy and procedures. Once you've verified the details, you can plan to return the packing materials and get your refund.

Remember to also take care of any other post-move tasks, such as updating your address with the post office, utilities, and other relevant parties. It's great that you're staying on top of things!
